model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!

[MEMORY]
Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities, which is why they have planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
memory_text: Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities, which is why they have planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
speaker: Speaker B
raw_prediction: Sounds like you're all set for your camping trips! Have you checked the weather forecast for those days?
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory provides useful past information about Speaker A's interest in camping and hiking and planned activities. This information is relevant in understanding why Speaker A stocked up on mosquito repellent and bracelets, although it isn't required to respond to the statement made by Speaker A in the dialogue context.
Judgement: Yes
